title: Opening
segmentation: Alright, so hi everyone, welcome to I clear 2016.
So yeah before we kick things off I thought I thought I would say a few words about the conference.
Give you a few stats, talk about the new things with this year and of course thank all the wonderful people that helped out in the event this year.
Alright, so as you probably know, in the past few years I have been growing extremely rapidly.

In fact, to the extent that for the program chairs it was kind of a worry that I would grow to extent, we would have a hard time managing that growth, so I want to take a bit of time to set the record straight so there are a few things I'm going to say that they might sound like blunders.
They might sound like mistakes that the program chairs might have made.

But they are not what I will hopefully convince you today is that they will actually carefully design measures that we put in place to make sure that this aggressive growth of I clear would be limited to something a bit more manageable.
I mean otherwise why?
Why would we announce that the submission deadline is actually in September before AI stats?
Another conference is only.
And to do something totally different, have a submission deadline in November.
Why would we do that?
Well, obviously we were hoping people would just take their paper to a nice date much earlier and then.
Once we postponed the deadline, well, the more impatient authors we actually submit to another conference.
That's obviously what we were trying to do.
Also, why I mean why otherwise would we say that will take some missions on openreview.net and then totally not?
Do that and use a totally different website on CMT.
I mean, you might be thinking I'm, you know this.
This is a little bit, don't you aware?
This is a little bit confusing.
Yes we are.
We are aware that it's confusing.
It's all by design.
And the Zika virus.
That's just a coincidence, not that would be taking it a bit too far.
So seriously, despite these little little hiccups, we have been growing quite a bit.
I'm giving you the stats here, so number of submissions, number of constant conference track papers that are accepted.
Workshop track papers accepted, and the number of attendees again saying we've been growing quite well in particular number of submissions.
So I write for 2013 up to 15.
I give you actually the total number of workshop and conference submissions before 16.
This is just the conference submissions, so it's actually more submissions.
That were made to I cleared this year, almost doubling what we had last year.
So things are going great.
Despite these little hiccups, we actually, I think, made a few positive changes to the conference that I want to mention, and actually we're looking forward to getting your feedback on some of these.
See what you think we get a chance to discuss that at the end of their conference.
But one thing we did is we change the conference track deadline.
It was in December before, which felt it was a bit awkward, was quite close to ICML, so we put it in November instead.
There was a deadline for just the papers information, and then.
Calling the work on archive, there was seven more days that we gave.

We actually kind of gave up that deadline because there were so many submissions that we were concerned archive would be overwhelmed and this would cause delays that went outside of the author's ability to fix.
So another thing we did that I think is a good changes that we actually have a different this year workshop trap deadline.
It was actually much closer to conference in February.
People could submit extended abstracts.
So this afternoon, in fact, the.
Poster session is all extended abstracts from this earlier deadline in February, so this is work that hasn't been on archive really, and so that a lot of it.
Probably you don't really know about.
This year we decided to have area chairs.
The first thing we do that we found last year was a bit harder to follow all the discussions.
Given the big amount of submissions that we got, so we thought we need some help and we got some amazing area chairs this year.
We have best paper awards.
You'll hear about that this week and so this is a first for a pair as well and perhaps one of my favorite.
We have student travel awards this year.
We gave about 30 of those so we're really happy about that.
We were able to do this thanks to.
Many sponsors we also increased the number of sponsors from 9 to 13.
This year we had a bunch of platinum sponsors, two which we didn't have last year, so thank you to all of our sponsors.
Baidu was actually sponsoring the breakfast this morning.
And finally, I just want to thank all the people involved in organizing the conference this year, so our wonderful 19 area chairs thanks a lot could have done it without you are 268 reviewers.
Thank you.
My wonderful Co chair.
Sammy and Brian was great working with you and thanks Joshua Nyan for all of your advice throughout the process.
And finally, behind the scene there's Karen Smith, who you should think if you're happy that we're in San Juan PR, she organized the whole thing.
So if you see her say thanks.
Rose you helped out with the registration and the financial aspects of it.
Rodrigo was in charge of the website for the registration which was really needed this year.
So thank you for that and not getting sound quality for providing some stats and spreadsheets for during the review process to the program chairs.
So you can find the schedule online at I cloud dot CC and many other things on Facebook.
You can go check and have those discussions page specifically for the event.
We also have a Twitter Periscope live streaming right now which we go.

People can go check out and many other things if you need the Wi-Fi information though if you don't end Internet, I guess that's a useful thing to tell you not particularly useful thing to tell you and I do want to mention that in the schedule.

On Wednesday, in the morning at 9:00, instead of a talk will have a town Hall meeting, so that's just a opportunity for people that want to talk about how they found the experience this year and what are things that would like to recommend for future years and so on.
This is a chance to give us your feedback so we can improve for the next year, so that's how I have to say, I wish you all a great I clear thank you.
